title: Few answers as Woburn-based Newpro files for bankruptcy after sudden shutdown
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Newpro, a Woburn-based home improvement firm, abruptly closed on October 28 and filed for bankruptcy in Delaware.
The company's bankruptcy filing affects over 10 subsidiaries under Renovo Home Partners, impacting customers and employees nationally.
Newpro, acquired by Renovo in 2022, reported assets between $10 million and $50 million in court documents.

title: Snag 20% off JetBlue flights in December during this limited-time sale
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: JetBlue offers 20% off flights during a two-day sale ending November 6 for December 2-18 travel.
Travelers booking round-trips through JetBlue Vacations can save up to 40% on packages for travel until March 31, 2026.
Discounts apply to select nonstop flights and are subject to availability, excluding Friday and Sunday travel.

title: WWII veteran’s remains are being returned to Weymouth
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: WWII veteran Private Alfred Langevin's remains are being returned to Weymouth after being unidentified for 81 years.
Langevin was reported missing in the 1944 Battle of Hürtgen Forest; his remains were identified via DNA in July 2025.
A public viewing and funeral procession for Langevin will take place in Weymouth before his burial with military honors.

title: Embattled Everett mayor loses reelection bid to city councilor
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Everett City Councilor Robert Van Campen defeated incumbent Mayor Carlo DeMaria by over 600 votes, ending DeMaria's 18-year tenure.
Mayor Carlo DeMaria faced scrutiny for $180,000 in questionable longevity payments and allegations of sexual harassment denied by him.
Van Campen's campaign focused on government transparency, addressing school overcrowding, traffic issues, and increasing accountability.

title: ‘The sun is up and we’re fighting’: Bill O’Brien’s fiery response to question about Boston College football
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston College football coach Bill O'Brien reacted strongly to questions about the team's 1-8 season record during a press conference.
O'Brien emphasized the team's continued effort and optimism, stressing the program is still being built in his second year as coach.
Boston College, ranked 35th in ESPN's 2026 recruiting class, has three games left this season, concluding against Syracuse on November 29.

title: Apparently, Mass. had a ‘gustnado’ touch down Monday night — and more wind is coming
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 'gustnado' occurred in Massachusetts on Monday with winds up to 40 mph in Worcester.
Southern New England is under high wind watch with gusts up to 65 mph expected Wednesday night.
Wind speeds could reach 75 mph near Provincetown; power outages and tree damage anticipated.

title: Trio sought in alleged unprovoked Halloween attack at downtown T station
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: MBTA Transit Police seek help identifying three suspects in alleged unprovoked Halloween attack at State Street station.
The assault occurred around 11 p.m. with surveillance photos released to aid in identifying the suspects.
Police urge anyone with information about the incident or suspects to contact them at 617-222-1050.

title: Bob Dylan accepts honorary doctorate from Berklee – just in time for tribute show
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Bob Dylan accepted an honorary doctorate from Boston's Berklee College of Music, his first from an American university since 1970.
Berklee President Jim Lucchese praised Dylan's evolving artistry, emphasizing its alignment with Berklee's creative spirit and mission.
Berklee hosted a tribute concert, 'Watching the River Flow: A Roots Salute to Bob Dylan,' featuring students and visiting artists.

title: Revolution reportedly set to hire Marko Mitrovic as head coach
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Marko Mitrovic is set to become head coach of the New England Revolution, succeeding Caleb Porter.
Mitrovic previously led the U.S. U-20 national team to the quarterfinals of the 2025 FIFA U-20 World Cup.
His hiring represents a strategic shift for the Revolution, aiming to leverage youth development and academy successes.

title: Trevor Story decides to stay with Red Sox, won’t opt out of contract
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Trevor Story will not opt out of his contract with the Boston Red Sox, remaining for the next two years.
Story signed a six-year, $140 million contract with the Red Sox in 2022 and played 157 games in 2025.
The Red Sox plan on keeping Story, despite his defensive struggles, while pursuing Alex Bregman and adjusting the infield lineup.
